page.title: 01Hardwick-with-Yelford
page.content: This is an area of open country, fairly flat, mostly forming part of the windrush valley. It includes the hamlet of Hardwic, part of yelford village and some other scattered settlements. The dominating activity now is the excavation of gravel and sand from a large valley area of the block. Most of the worked-out pits remain as fairly large lakes, some used for water sports by private clubs, a few infilled. The workings create quite a large amount of heavy traffic which is increased by a busy main road which passes through the area to the west of the River. The other main activity is agriculture now mainly corn growing, plus some pasture and a small amount of woodland. Most of the three hundred or so residents commute to jobs in nearby towns (Whitney and Oxford). A small number
